docs.snippet: Royal Ahold, the Dutch supermarket operator, moved today to limit the damage from an accounting scandal by replacing the chief executive and board of its Argentine unit, Disco, and dispatching a Dutch management team to keep an eye on the unit.   ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Royal Ahold, the Dutch supermarket operator, moved today to limit the damage from an accounting scandal by replacing the chief executive and board of its Argentine unit, Disco, and dispatching a Dutch management team to keep an eye on the unit. Ahold said it had completed an internal review of Disco's books and had found nothing amiss that could materially affect the parent company's reported results. Even so, Argentine tax authorities said they were preparing to investigate the legality of some accounting procedures at Disco.
docs.abstract: Dutch supermarket operator Royal Ahold moves to limit damage from accounting scandal by replacing chief executive and board of its Argentine unit Disco and dispatching Dutch management team to oversee unit; Garcia Pye, head of Ahold's Santa Isabel chain in Peru, to be Disco's chief executive; says internal review of Disco's books shows nothing that could materially affect parent company's reported results; Argentine tax authorities say they are investigating legality of some accounting procedures at Disco; Ahold's biggest problems stem from irregularities at American subsidiary US Foodservice; photo (M)

headline.main: Royal Ahold Ousts Leadership of Its Argentine Unit

docs.snippet: The FIFA executive committee decided yesterday that the 2014 World Cup would be held in South America, returning there for the first time since 1978.     The United States, which staged the World Cup in 1994, had intended to bid for the 2014...
docs.lead_paragraph: The FIFA executive committee decided yesterday that the 2014 World Cup would be held in South America, returning there for the first time since 1978. The United States, which staged the World Cup in 1994, had intended to bid for the 2014 tournament. The U.S. Soccer Federation will now focus on bidding for the 2018 World Cup.
docs.abstract: FIFA announces that 2014 World Cup will be held in South America (S)

docs.snippet: The Agriculture Department has been lax in guarding the food supply from potentially unsafe imported meat, an internal audit says.    From 1999 to 2001, the agency allowed in 823,632 pounds of meat from foreign plants that might have been prohibited...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Agriculture Department has been lax in guarding the food supply from potentially unsafe imported meat, an internal audit says. From 1999 to 2001, the agency allowed in 823,632 pounds of meat from foreign plants that might have been prohibited from trading, said the report by the agency's inspector general released this week.
docs.abstract: Agriculture Dept's inspector general finds department is lax in guarding food supply from potentially unsafe imported meat; says thousands of pounds of meat were shipped from processors unapproved for shipping products to United States and some of it came from countries with outbreaks of foot-and-mouth disease; finds department has not carried out recommendations from earlier audit and still needs system to annually check whether countries are complying with food safety requirements; department generally agreed with recommendations (M)

headline.main: Auditors Cite Lax Standards For Checking Imported Meat

docs.snippet: The world is suddenly a wonderful place again for CHRISTIE PEARCE, the speedy United States national team and Power defender.     ''I definitely had a rough year in 2002, coming off A.C.L. surgery and having such a terrible season in the W.U.S.A.,''...
docs.lead_paragraph: The world is suddenly a wonderful place again for CHRISTIE PEARCE, the speedy United States national team and Power defender. ''I definitely had a rough year in 2002, coming off A.C.L. surgery and having such a terrible season in the W.U.S.A.,'' Pearce said yesterday from a small hotel room in Portugal, where the United States played its first two games in the 12-nation Algarve Cup. ''I rushed back, and mentally and physically, I wasn't ready. On top of that, losing as many games and giving up as many goals against really put a weight on my shoulders.''
docs.abstract: New York Power defender Christie Pearce sees better start to 2003 MLS and international season, after year battling injury (M)

docs.snippet: Isabel Ortega, a full-blooded Aymara-Quechua Indian who dresses in the black bowler and heavily layered 19th-century dress common to her people, is one of Bolivia's newest members of Congress.    But that has not kept guards from trying to bar her...
docs.lead_paragraph: Isabel Ortega, a full-blooded Aymara-Quechua Indian who dresses in the black bowler and heavily layered 19th-century dress common to her people, is one of Bolivia's newest members of Congress. But that has not kept guards from trying to bar her from the ornate building where the halls of power have long been the exclusive domain of buttoned-down descendants of Europeans.
docs.abstract: Indigenous and dark-skinned people across Latin America and their supporters are organizing as never before and using new more open democracies to take on traditional, light-skinned ruling classes they blame for keeping their countries mired in poverty and monopolizing power for 500 years; movements are filled with Indians in Andes, blacks and mixed-race 'caboclos' and 'mulatos' in Brazil or the poor of Argentina's outlying provinces, and their ranks are united by dark color of their skin and their low economic station; changing scene in Bolivia, Peru, Brazil, Ecuador and other Latin American countries discussed; photos; map; table (L)

headline.main: Native Latins Are Astir and Thirsty for Power

byline.original: By JUAN FORERO with LARRY ROHTER

docs.snippet: Japanese soccer officials announced yesterday that its men's national team would not travel to the United States for two exhibition games because of the war in Iraq.     Japan was scheduled to play Uruguay on Wednesday and the United States next...
docs.lead_paragraph: Japanese soccer officials announced yesterday that its men's national team would not travel to the United States for two exhibition games because of the war in Iraq. Japan was scheduled to play Uruguay on Wednesday and the United States next Saturday in Seattle. Instead, the United States has enlisted Venezuela, one of the weakest national teams in South America, as a replacement.
docs.abstract: Japan cancels men's national team games in US because of war in Iraq (S)

docs.snippet: Royal Ahold, the troubled multinational food retailer based in the Netherlands, said today that it planned to sell its South American businesses, including the Argentine store chain where some of its problems arose, to raise cash and reduce debt.   ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Royal Ahold, the troubled multinational food retailer based in the Netherlands, said today that it planned to sell its South American businesses, including the Argentine store chain where some of its problems arose, to raise cash and reduce debt. The announcement presents the other grocery heavyweights who have ambitions in the region -- Carrefour and Casino of France, and Wal-Mart Stores -- with an opportunity to expand rapidly, particularly in Brazil and Argentina.
docs.abstract: Royal Ahold plans to sell its South American businesses, including Argentine store chain Disco where some of its financial problems arose, to raise cash and reduce debt; will sell 429 supermarkets in Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay and Peru; is already in talks to sell its Chilean stores to Cencosud, local group, where accounting scandal at company became public Feb 24; market interest so far is focusing on units that are seen as crown jewels in Ahold's Latin crown--Bom Preco and G Barbosa chains in Brazil and Disco; photo (M)

headline.main: Royal Ahold to Sell Its South American Businesses

docs.snippet: IVESTING in emerging stock markets has always been risky for mutual fund managers, but finding rising markets has become even more challenging lately.    Eleven of 28 emerging markets rose in the first quarter, but some markets were so small that...
docs.lead_paragraph: IVESTING in emerging stock markets has always been risky for mutual fund managers, but finding rising markets has become even more challenging lately. Eleven of 28 emerging markets rose in the first quarter, but some markets were so small that many fund managers missed them entirely. Only 7 of 133 emerging-markets mutual funds tracked by Morningstar rose in the quarter, and 41 percent fell more than the Morgan Stanley Capital International index for this sector, a widely used benchmark.

headline.main: Mutual Funds Report; Bonds Eclipse Stocks in Emerging Markets

docs.snippet: Uruguay asked bondholders to swap as much as $6.5 billion of debt due through 2027 for new securities that have longer maturities and are worth less, a transaction Standard & Poor's said would constitute a default. Uruguay wants at least 80 percent...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay asked bondholders to swap as much as $6.5 billion of debt due through 2027 for new securities that have longer maturities and are worth less, a transaction Standard & Poor's said would constitute a default. Uruguay wants at least 80 percent of bondholders to accept new securities that mature five years later and carry the same interest as the debt they own, the economy minister, Alejandro Atchugarry, said at a news conference. S.& P. cut the government's long-term foreign currency rating to CC from CCC and said it would lower it to ''selective default'' in mid-May if a sufficient number of bondholders take part in the exchange. (Bloomberg News)
docs.abstract: Uruguay asks bondholders to swap as much as $6.5 billion of debt due through 2027 for new securities that have longer maturities and are worth less (S)1

headline.main: World Business Briefing | Americas: Uruguay: Bond Exchange Sought
